desc_merge: A military unit must prepare supply packages for aerial delivery to forward bases, where each supply type (e.g., ammunition, rations) has a weight [9, 1, 8, 7, 8, 10, 9, 4, 9, 7], a volume [1, 1, 1, 2, 5, 5, 1, 5, 5, 2], a priority score [10, 3, 17, 1, 18, 17, 18, 11, 3, 13], and a maximum available quantity [3, 5, 5, 3, 3, 1, 4, 3, 5, 1]. Each cargo plane has a strict maximum payload 43 and cargo hold volume 16. The challenge is to select the optimal mix and quantity of supplies to load into each aircraft to maximize the total priority of delivered goods while adhering to both weight and volume constraints, ensuring critical mission needs are met under logistical limitations.

A space agency is planning a scientific mission to deploy instruments on a satellite, where each instrument has a mass [1, 3, 4, 3, 3, 3, 1, 5, 9, 1], a size [3, 2, 3, 5, 5, 4, 1, 3, 4, 3], a scientific value [9, 1, 1, 15, 5, 13, 11, 10, 12, 16], and a maximum number of units available [1, 1, 5, 3, 5, 5, 1, 1, 3, 3]. The satellite has a maximum launch mass capacity 19 and a fixed instrument bay volume 19. The objective is to choose which instruments and how many of each to include in the payload to maximize the total scientific return of the mission without exceeding the spacecraft's mass and volume limits, optimizing research outcomes within engineering boundaries.

A catering company is designing a menu for a large event with multiple food stations, where each menu item has a preparation time weight [8, 3, 9, 2, 7, 6, 4, 10, 2, 8], a storage space requirement [3, 4, 5, 5, 2, 1, 3, 4, 4, 3], a customer preference score [8, 5, 17, 11, 12, 11, 16, 8, 11, 9], and a maximum preparation limit per station [5, 4, 3, 1, 5, 1, 3, 5, 5, 3]. Each serving station has a maximum total preparation time capacity 35 and a physical space limit 20. The aim is to determine the optimal quantities of each menu item to assign to each station to maximize total guest satisfaction while respecting both time and space constraints, ensuring efficient service and high attendee enjoyment.

A national library is selecting materials to digitize and store in a new digital archive system, where each collection item (e.g., book, manuscript) has a data storage size [8, 4, 6, 4, 8, 1, 10, 7, 3, 4], a processing time cost [5, 5, 5, 2, 3, 1, 2, 4, 4, 3], a historical significance rating [18, 3, 12, 4, 11, 5, 9, 20, 6, 9], and a maximum number of copies available for digitization [4, 3, 2, 5, 4, 1, 4, 5, 1, 4]. The archive server has a maximum total storage capacity 33 and a processing time budget per cycle 20. The problem is to select which items and how many copies to digitize to maximize the total historical value preserved while staying within the server's storage and processing limits, enhancing cultural heritage accessibility.

A construction firm is sourcing materials for a project with multiple suppliers, where each material type has a cost per unit weight [5, 7, 3, 6, 7, 2, 6, 9, 7, 2], a bulk storage space requirement [3, 3, 1, 4, 2, 5, 3, 1, 3, 2], a project criticality value [11, 4, 5, 14, 13, 3, 16, 18, 4, 9], and a maximum purchase limit from suppliers [4, 2, 5, 5, 5, 5, 1, 2, 3, 5]. The project's central warehouse has a maximum budget capacity for material costs 32 and a total storage area volume 16. The goal is to decide the optimal quantities of each material to procure to maximize overall project utility while not exceeding the budget and storage space, ensuring timely completion and resource efficiency.

An airline needs to load cargo into the hold of a passenger aircraft, where each cargo type has a weight [1, 3, 3, 10, 4, 4, 6, 8, 8, 4], a volume [4, 3, 3, 4, 1, 1, 5, 4, 3, 4], a revenue value [17, 15, 15, 4, 16, 3, 12, 16, 18, 7], and a maximum available quantity [1, 5, 5, 1, 4, 1, 4, 4, 5, 3]. The aircraft's cargo hold has strict maximum weight 30 and volume 19 restrictions for safety and balance. The objective is to select the optimal mix and quantity of cargo to load, maximizing total revenue while adhering to both the weight and volume constraints of the hold, ensuring efficient use of space and maximum profitability for the flight.

A cloud computing provider needs to allocate virtual machines (VMs) to a physical server, where each VM type consumes CPU resources [8, 5, 5, 8, 6, 2, 4, 1, 6, 10], memory resources [1, 4, 5, 4, 4, 3, 3, 3, 4, 1], generates a profit [19, 2, 5, 7, 16, 3, 9, 19, 11, 10], and has a maximum number of available instances [3, 4, 2, 4, 3, 3, 5, 2, 3, 1]. The physical server has a total CPU capacity 33 and a total memory capacity 19. The goal is to determine the optimal number of each VM type to host on the server, maximizing total profit without exceeding either the CPU or memory capacities, thus optimizing resource utilization and return on investment.

A humanitarian organization is assembling emergency relief kits for rapid deployment, where each supply item (like food packets or medical supplies) has a weight [8, 1, 9, 6, 5, 2, 10, 8, 1, 8], a bulk volume [4, 4, 2, 3, 1, 3, 5, 5, 2, 4], a critical utility value [20, 8, 3, 17, 13, 12, 17, 2, 20, 5], and a maximum stock level [2, 3, 3, 1, 4, 3, 3, 4, 3, 5]. A mobile game developer is creating in-app purchase bundles, where each potential asset (like a character skin or power-up) has a download size [10, 5, 6, 6, 9, 5, 1, 4, 2, 10], a development cost [2, 1, 5, 4, 4, 5, 1, 4, 4, 2], an estimated player value [20, 1, 16, 19, 19, 17, 4, 17, 8, 12], and a maximum number of times it can be included across bundles [4, 3, 5, 3, 1, 4, 5, 4, 1, 5].
